title.narrative: UNIDO-Vanuatu Country Programme of Technical Cooperation (2015-2020) to Promote Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development in Vanuatu

description.narrative: The Government of the Republic of Vanuatu took the initiatives to avail the assistance of UNIDO and re-established the cooperation in 2012. Vanuatu Government expressed interest and willingness to cooperate with UNIDO in the key priority areas of industrial policy, agribusiness development, renewable energy and trade capacity building. The decision and willingness for greater cooperation with UNIDO has been communicated to the UNIDO HQs through the letter dater 12th September 2013 by the Ministry of Tourism, Trades, Commerce and Ni-Vanuatu Business (MTTCNVB). Subsequent official letter of Director General, DG Trade at MTTCNVB dated 27 June 2014 to UNIDO Director General, presented the specific industrial issues where technical assistance cooperation (TC) of UNIDO was required in line with the renewed mandate of inclusive and sustainable industrial development (ISID).
